citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A male turkey was observed to be limping on his right leg while walking. The turkey was also observed to hold its right leg
up while standing. The licensee stated the the turkey was acquired with the leg condition and that the bird has not been
evaluated by the Attending Veterinarian (AV). Untreated conditions can be painful and affect the well-being of the animal.
The turkey must be evaluated by the Attending Veterinarian and any prescribed treatments must be followed.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
3.154
The licensee's environmental enhancement plan to promote the psychological well- being of the birds housed at the
facility is not complete. It does not make provisions for social grouping, special considerations, restraint devices and
exemptions. Lack of a complete environmental enhancement plan does not ensure that adequate and appropriate
measures to promote the psychological well-being of the birds are being provided. The licensee must develop, document
and follow an environmental enhancement plan that addresses all requirements of the plan. The plan must also be
approved by the AV.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class C license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) or by November 13, 2023 or the applicant will forfeit the
license fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License
Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
A male turkey was observed to be limping on his right leg while walking. The turkey was also observed to hold its right leg 
up while standing. The licensee stated the the turkey was acquired with the leg condition and that the bird has not been 
evaluated by the Attending Veterinarian (AV). Untreated conditions can be painful and affect the well-being of the animal. 
The turkey must be evaluated by the Attending Veterinarian and any prescribed treatments must be followed. 
3.154(a) 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
3.154 
The licensee's environmental enhancement plan to promote the psychological well- being of the birds housed at the 
facility is not complete. It does not make provisions for social grouping, special considerations, restraint devices and 
exemptions. Lack of a complete environmental enhancement plan does not ensure that adequate and appropriate 
measures to promote the psychological well-being of the birds are being provided. The licensee must develop, document 
and follow an environmental enhancement plan that addresses all requirements of the plan. The plan must also be 
approved by the AV. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class C license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) or by November 13, 2023 or the applicant will forfeit the 
license fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License 
Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
 n
